sentence.text: ` A troubled soul , vexed and tormented by his own lusts and pleasures . "
Thorwall died soon after , tormented by visions of GHOULS and PHANTOMS .
Their modern subjectivity tormented them with a consciousness of what they had lost .
It tormented me beyond all endurance , while at the same time the awful silence of the terrible prison weighed me down .
Palottino had no answer to that , any more than Zen himself , though the question had tormented him for the whole drive back to Perugia .
It was the question that had been tormenting her from the very moment she had seen him enter the room .
Very soon a cold stone wall of silence had tormented them to wounded exasperation .
Sleeping was no better -- fleabites tormented him , fears plagued him like bad dreams .
Understood the dreams and images that tormented him , the listless refusal of his shrouded days .
You may be fully in control in your own home and yet be tormented by feelings of insecurity at work .
She has been tormented by what has happened .
And he was tormented by the idea , by the conviction , that he had missed something .
` How , indeed ? " said the headmaster , who was tormented with indecision whenever he spoke with Septimus Coffin , how far to take him seriously .
The smell of the steaming meat tormented them until their mouths slavered and their eyes rolled .
Maria is a fanciful girl , probably tormented by ambitions that are not realistic , especially for a young woman .
Christopher Gore , a genius tormented by mental illness , who finally lost control and killed his parents .
Look hard and long , and then think of your father Iying here tormented with cold and pain and fear and despair .
